text: Bottle at home. Bit hazy deep mahogany with beige head, looks pretty good. Lots of chocolate and vanilla, strong sweet malts, bourbon, cognac, raisins, toffee. Light herbal finish with light chalk. Quite sweet with a bit weird herbal dry bitter finish and a bit of booze. Full bodied with low carbonation. Very nice, but really strong barrel notes.
Bottle - Dark roast and butterscotch barrel notes. Jet black with a small beige head. Light and sweet butterscotch barrel notes. Smooth and easy drinking.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 Donker amberrood, crèmekleurige schuimkraag, troebel en nog aardig wat langzaam stijgend koolzuur. 
Aroma: Rozijn, donker fruit, vanille, bourbon, zoetig, alcohol. 
Smaak: Bitterkoekjes, toffee, roomboterbabbelaar, vanille, karamel, Zoetig, veel bourbon en pittig alcohol en warmte......maar ook flink bitter gehopt. Ook komt mooi een hout toets naar voren....wat droog en leerachtig. Zeer prettig.
Mooie fruitige hinten...donker fruit en een licht fruitig zuurtje...donkere bes.
Vanille en boozy alcohol blijven ook flink op de voorgrond.  Veel smaak en absoluut een sipper!
Volle body, zacht koolzuur, zacht en romig mondgevoel.  Afdronk is grond/Mossig en droog met vanille en alcohol. 
Vind hem heerlijk!

Mahogany color with a bit of beige foam with large bubbles. Aroma is dried fruit forward with figs, dates and raisin notes. Also caramel and woody/earthy notes. Taste starts with really nice toffee and caramel, continues with an aromatic wood bitterness and lingers on the aftertaste with butterscotch flavor. Medium body, slightly sticky, soft carbonation. You can feel its a big beer but its not too sweet, actually it has a healthy dose of bitterness, making it dangerously drinkable. After it warms up, you can taste the booze but its not too bad.

Bottle shared at home. Black with thin white head. Big bourbon, deep roasted barley malts, dates, licorice, laurel, motor oil, rubber tire, bandaids, raincoat, leather, vanilla, tutti frutti, wet grass under full moon with a shiny goat dropping, peat, blackberries, firm alcoholic, nutty, ashy, bouillon. Quite sweet and bitter but in harmony. Full body, soft carbonation. Heavy and all over the place.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lion, donker kastanje bruin met een creme kraag. in teakolie gedrenkte rozijnen. nasmaak met leer en een droge trekkende afdronk.

(Emelisse White Label Barley Wine (Old Smokey Moonshine BA)) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a small tulip, ABV 12%
Dark brown colour on the body, small and a bit thin tan head on top with good retention though.
Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, dates, bourbon, vanilla, alcohol.
Taste follows, plenty of dark fruits, notable alcohol, nice bourbon notes, vanilla, brown sugar.
Medium thick body, soft carbonation.
Very nice!

Bottled 330ml (BB 12/2022)
Dark ruby color, small beige head. Vanilla toffee, malts in the nose. Medium-bodied. Sweet vanilla, bourbon booze, toffee. A bit one-dimensional bourbon-dominated brew. Not my favourite from White Labe series.
Bottled. Deep amber colour small head. Aroma is vanilla, wood, some sweet ripe fruits and some alcohol. Flavour is sweet, some wood, vanilla and some ripe fruits. Quite boozy finish.

33cl bottle. Bbe 12/2022.
Poured dark brown color with a thin white head. 
Aroma has bready malts, bourbon, wood, some mild vanilla notes. 
Flavor is sweet with dark bread, bourbon, malts, syrup, some licorice and alcohol warmth. Pretty good sipper, although the bourbon is almost too dominating.
Shared bottle at RB/HD at Sigmund´s 24.02.17. Brown. Small and diminishing pale brown head. Aroma of dark malt, fermented dark berries. Similar taste, with rum and rasin ice cream.
Shared bottle at RBHD, Tau. Pours almost clear dark amber with no head. Aroma is typical BW, rich malty. Taste is round, smooth heavy malts, lovely lingering dark fruits.

Shared 330 ml at local tasting. Dark brown colour, no head. Malty aroma, notes of molasses, oak and bourbon, but not as distinct as expected. Rounded sweet flavour, malty with notes of molasses, fairly distinct notes of oak, bourbon and vanilla.

Flaske delt på RBHD-treff hos Sigmund feb-17: brunlig rav nesten uten skum. Barleywine-aroma og smak med sviskeplommer, rosiner, vanilje og lys sjokolade. Vinøs ettersmak. Rund og mild for sin voltstyrke. Barley wines er gode greier, og denne er farlig lettdrikkelig.

33cl from the tap at Proeflokaal MOUT. Appearance: hazy dark brown with reddish hue and a low tan head. Aroma: chocolate, caramel, fudge, figs, dark fruits, vanilla and oak. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of chocolate, caramel, whisky, mocca ice cream and dark fruits. Palate: full bodied, oily to sticky texture and soft carbonation.

Bottle thanks to MonsterMagnet. Aroma: Barrel, vanilla, light smoke, light alcohol, malts. Appearance: Low head, dark brown body. Taste: Thats awesome - vanilla, light smoke, lots of dried fruit, caramelly malts, great balance. Palate: Sweet finish, high body, low carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 33cl glass at Proeflokaal Mout in Groningen. Pours a darkbrown to black colour with a small off white soapy head. Aroma of vanilla, oak, roasted malts, candy sugar, bourbon, dark malts, banana, brown sugar. Taste is fairly sweet as expected, medium bitter with a sweet warming finish. Notes of dark malts, ripe fruit, light resin, chocolate, syrup, raisin, bourbon, fudge. Texture is thick and creamy, full bodied with soft carbonation.

330 ml bottle. Pours black with light foamy head. Aromas of fruity liqueur, dark caramel, and sweet roasted malts. Rich smooth flavors of caramel, bourbon, sweet malts, and dark fruits. Beautiful balance with really nice carbonation. Doesnt get much better.

Intensiv malziger Antrunk, deutliche Süße. Dunkle brotige Noten, erkennbarer aber nicht störender Alkoholeinfluss. Erstaunlich süffig, steigend holzig, auch der Alkohol steigt an. Weich, vollmundig. 9/12/11/12/11/12

Bottle, BB 12.2022 (from hiet biermoment?). Pours dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is sweet, caramel candy, malt, whisky. Flavor is sweet and bitter, a lot of caramel, candy, toffee, malt, some bourbon. Alcohol is rather covered. Overall: great brew, a tad sweet maybe.

A dark, slightly reddish beer, a head is small and beige. Aroma has richness of dried fruits, raisins, toffee, some smoke, barrel and alcohol. Intensive. Taste has sweet and dried fruitness, caramel, some dry barrel, raisin and madeira. Not too sweet. Medium+ bodied, not stickyness. Great balance, dried fruity, quite simple anyway.
Flesje thuis, mooi karamel, vrij donker. Ruikt heerlijk, zoet, stroop, drop, en de barrel natuurlijk. Smaak is sterk, beetje alcoholisch maar ook veel zoet, mooi in balans. Lekker dik mondgevoel.

Bottle at home, 9th December 16. Pours a dark copper, cola beer, with little head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, candy, caramel. Taste is sweet, wood, bourbon, vanilla, booze. Bit of heat in the finish, nice sipper.

Emelisse barley smokey
Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Creamy head. Really dark brown body.
Nose of cough syrup, oat and malts. Little liquor like rum tint. Thats it...
Flavour is alcoholic with a litle burn, some cough syrup, little rum, malts, oat, little honey and some fruit... I dont get much else...
Aftertaste is malts, alcohol, some bitters, grains and oat...
Low carbo, burning mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Jesus Christ, this gets 100/100?! Wtf!
I love this brewery, but this isnt by far a good Barley Wine from them at all.
And this also isnt their 3rd best beer. Well not in my books!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 33cl bottle at home from Kaapse Brouwers, Rotterdam. Nose is leather, dark berries, light smoked wood, konyak. Body is dark brown, head is small, beige, creamy, average lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is bourbon, konyak, wood, light peat, molasses, herbs, vodka. Medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is long lasting fruity medium sweet, light sour, umami, hint of hoppy bitter, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Heavy fruity liquorish dessert beer, bit too sweet for me, but very special aroma, nice one.

Clear, coca cola look a like. Very small head. Aroma has black malts, trees, nuts, dark fruits. Taste has malts, toffee, dark fruits, vanilla, raisins and nuts. Alcohol is available with whisky wheeling, but not too much. Quite sweet, but once again, not too much. Full body, low carbonation. One of the best barley wines that exists.
Leichter Rosenduft. Schwere Süße der extrem malzigen Art. Dann komplex holzvanillebitter. Der Alkohol ist am Ende wohlig wärmend DEIN Freund. Arendsnest Happening. Tap.

An already great barley wine made even better by the moonshine. It adds a little bit of booze and some vanilla and tannins. Very well balanced and complex. Another brilliant white label from Emelisse.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 Bottle at home. Deep brown colour, creamy beige head. Boozy, bourbon, caramel and dried fruit malty nose. Taste is vinous, marzipan, nuts, dried fruits, vanilla and really (!) boozy: complex, not too sweet, quite bitter. Big body, low carbonation, oily mouthfeel.

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, fruit, dried fruit, chocolate, roasted malts and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, wood, vanilla, fruit, dried fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and slightly/medium dry with roasted malts and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. What an amazingly rich and complex flavour. Has so many different sweet flavours, without being overly sweet at all. What a great beer overall.
Bottle from Biernavigatie. Hazy amber colour, creamy white foam. Nose of sweet malts, honey, caramel, bourbon, vanilla. Warming alcohol finish. Very nice sipper!
33cl bottle at home. Pitch black with a small brown head. Full body with low carbonation. Nice bitter and sweet tones. Chocolate, caramel, malts, nuts, booze. Very good (again).

0,33l bottle at home. BB 12/2022. dark brown color, small tan head. smells milky, earthy, nutty, marzipan, dark fruits, light wood, some coconut, quite nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes strongly of caramel, some licorice, nutty, marzipan, light coconut, dark fruits, wood, light alcohol warmth. finishes lightly sweet with notes of caramel, light wood and light alcohol warmth. very nice, very subtle but also very smooth for 12% ABV.

Bottle at home (compared with other White Label) pours deep dark brown with small tan head. The aroma is sweet and whisky; develops after a while instead of dropping down. The taste is quite or even fully sweet, chocolate and vanilla, roasted malts with clear whisky tones, full & alcoholic.
Nice beer, great fun. And interesting to compare with other white labels (as I did with RIS Bruichladdach; which is darker, more bitter, less sweet, but looses its aroma).
Bottle from De Bierkoning. Deep reddish dark brown. Nose is toffee and caramel, vanilla, bourbon. Tastes rich and sweet, big caramel and bourbon, red fruits, vanilla.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Bottle. Dark brown muddy pour. Aroma has boozy vanilla, figs, raisin, caramel and oak. Smooth flavor of ripe fruit, raisin, vanilla, caramel, booze, caramelised malt, buttery toffee and a long boozy fruity finish. Great dessert wine.

33 cl bottle. BBE 12/2022.
Pours dark brown color with a very small head. Nice sweet caramel aroma, maybe some syrup, subtle vanilla, wood and some malts, all-in-all intoxicating aroma. Honey-coated malty and woody flavor, vanilla, caramel, maybe some toffee. Not too sweet even though there are a lot of different sweet flavors, carbonation is soft. Super smooth, full-bodied with an excellent balance, wheres the alcohol? Exquisite slow sipper.
4327

Bottle @ home. Opaque dark brown to red-brown color, average sized off-white to beige head. Aroma is malts, chocolate, booze. Taste malts, chocolate, booze, lightly dark fruits, bourbon, brandy, caramel and more booze. Medium to full body, sticky texture, medium carbonation. A full bodied heavy boozy barley wine. Expected it to be too boozy but its very nice indeed. Well done!
Bottle shared with C wegeberg. Brown, almost no head. Aromas of caramel, vanilla, honey and smoked malts. Taste is sugar, caramel and honey. Full body. Good beer!

33cl Bottle, thanks Henkie! As Old Smokey Moonshine BA. Dark brown colour, creamy light-beige head. Aroma of coconut, vanilla, booze, wood, dark fruits, chocolate, nice and rich. Flavour is sweet, malty, coconut, vanilla, wood, milk chocolate, raisin, treacle, booze, harsh woody alcoholic finish. Full bodied, smooth. Really nice, totally different from previous White Label Barley Wines, more like a BA Quad.

Donker rood, ruby kleurig bier met een goede witte/off white schuim kraag.
Ruikt naar toffee, zoet, vanille, bourbon, hout. Smaakt naar vanille, bourbon, zoet, plakkerig, toffee, witte chocolade. Lekkaah

hazy mahogany colour, half inch creamy beige-ish head; aroma of caramel, coconut, vanilla, whisky, raisins and woody notes, cookies, hints of chocolate, walnut liqueur and even some minimal herbal notes, too; taste of syrupy sweetness, coconut, bourbon notes, vanilla, toffee, milk chocolate bonbon filled with dried sour cherry, desert red wine, walnut and hints of mild roasted coffee; spicy alcoholic aftertaste; its a miracle, not a beer!

Dark barley wine by Emelisse, lot A. Thin and loosely structured, off-white head leaving a thin moussy rim on the edge and some thin veils of beige foam in the middle; colour is a deep, warm, ruby red-hued brownish bronze, very dark and certainly much darker than average for the style, but still translucent, like a quadrupel. Intense and perfumey, enticing aroma of Belgian chocolates, woody tannins and vanilla-like oak, lots of bourbon nicely interwoven with the rest, milk chocolate, marzipan, cashew nuts, candied cherries, toffee, hint of beef broth, honey liqueur, brandy, gingerbread, kahlua, lots of candied fig, some dry earth, hint of tea, marmelade, ripe blue plum, ruby port, chocolate cake, amaretto, Haagse hopjes, brown sugar melting on hot pancakes, liquorish candy. Concentrated candied sweet onset, lots of candied date and raisin, ripe blue plum and blackcurrant with a slight sourish touch, very vague beefy umami somewhere, lots of residual brown sugar sweetness but nothing sticky; soft carbo but just right for a barley wine, very vinous, oily, supple but thick mouthfeel, layers of caramelly, lightly nutty and deeply chocolatey malt sweetness in the middle while the candied fruit sweetness persists on top of it. Finish turns things around with a drying, tannin-rich, very agreeable woodiness releasing some oaky vanilla retronasally; unsurprisingly for such a beer, this is followed by a heavy dosis of warming, liqueurish and brandy-like alcohol, though I get no astringency whatsoever. A herbal, structurally important but inobtrusive herbal hop bitterish touch does the rest, with a slightly peppery character to it which is hard to distinguish from the peppery qualities of the alcohol itself. In any case: this is a beautiful, rich sipper, one of the best dark barley wines I ever had, with a heavy load of almost furniture-like woodiness contrasting with the basic candied and caramelly sweetness. Complex, perfumey, multi-layered slow sipping beer: this is close to divine, at least if you like your beers strong, vinous, sweet and dark. Easily recommendable for quadrupel lovers as well and doubtlessly a beer which benefits from a couple of years of cellaring.

amber/bruin/rood met fijne licht kaki kraag. aroma is enorm zoet, alcohol, caramel, bourbon, graan, mais, suiker. Smaken zijn zwaar zoet, enorm dik, glad/smooth, vanille, bourbon, graan, mais, enorm alcoholisch, donker fruit zoals pruim, plakkerig zoet, volle body, lage co2, granige afdronk. prima
[9/25/16] Draught sample at Borefts After Festival 2016 in Rotterdam. Brown. Aroma of malt, caramel, wood, vanilla. Sweet flavor with caramel, cookies, vanilla, wood, alcohol note. Rounded mouthfeel.

Bottle at home. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, vanilla fudge, bourbon, toffee, booze, sweet dried fruits, oak, marzipan, touch of nuts. Flavour is very sweet and moderate bitter with a potent bittersweet and slightly boozy finish. Body is full, rich and thick. Amazing Moonshine BA Barley Wine, massive flavour and deep aroma. Great stuff!
Chocolade bruine kleur met een kleine, doch goede kraag. Ruikt vol, vanille, crème, beetje gerookt, bourbon. Smaakt vol vanille, crème, bourbon, alcohol, iets gerookt. Erg lekker.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Bottle, pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Somewhat boozy aroma with dried fruit, marzipan and bourbon. Taste follows with vanilla fudge, dried apricot, raisins, woody notes, sweet liquorice. Sweet, silky, full bodied and boozy, with some bitterness in the finish. Sounds nausiating, but it?s not. Not at all, it?s just lovely.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a hazy opaque to brown with a small yellowish off-white head and an aroma of syrup, bourbon, vanilla, honey, toffee, overripe fruits, plums, corn, rum and brown sugar. The taste is very sweet, with a full body and a very soft carbonation. Very nice!
Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Malt, dried fruit, vanilla, peat and bourbon in the aroma. Full bodied. Malty sweet flavor with oak, vanilla, peat and bourbon. Warming alcohol. Low on carbon. Good!

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2017 Sampled at Borefts After Fest 2016, Kaapse, and later from a bottle. Dark pour with a tan head. Notes of caramel, toffee, subtle dried fruit, tons of bourbon, vanilla and toasted coconut. Smooth texture, full body, low carbonation and a nice bitter-sweet finish. An amazing barleywine, they nailed the barrel on this one perfectly.

Bottle at Broer & Zus, Beverwijk. Pours dark with almost no head. Sweet aroma of bourbon-like alcohol, dark fruits, toffee, caramel. Taste is heavy sweet, lots of alcohol, dark fruits, caramel. Warming alcohol in the aftertaste. Nice.

Bottle @ Emelisse, Kamperland - NL. Color: deep dark amber/brown beer with no carbonation and small ivory foam. Smell: caramel malt, sweet domination and small boozy bourbon alcohol finish. Taste: full body with caramel domination, toffee taste. Intensive malt with bourbon notes, and alcohol. Well balanced. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: caramel, toffee, malt and bourbon notes. Very nice!

bottle at home, poured a clear dark amber to brown colour with a light tanned head, nose of sweet caramel, fudge, butterscotch, spirit, not a real bourbon barrel, oak, vanilla, dried prunes. taste of sweet prunes, not as barrel forward as a previous bourbon barrel. sticky but medium bodied

Thank you for sharing Israeli Crew! Sampled draft @ BAF 2016. Plus 2 additional tasting glasses. Deep amber red. Nose is massive thick frangipane, sweet basic sugar, so sweet insane toffee, caramel, candy more frangipane, sweet vanilla bourbon, sweet oak. Taste is amazing pleasantly boozy massive frangipane, toffee, warming pie, caramel, toffee, vanilla, huge bourbon, sweet vanilla, oak, warming, more frangipane. Taste is super thick molasses, frangipanes, molasses, sugar, candy. Insanely good, dear lord. Would love to try Ole Smoky Moonshine.
Draft at BAF 2016. Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of butterscotch, caramel, booze, alcohol and toffee. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation. [25-09-2016]
Dark brown almost black coloured beer with beige head. Aroma is sweet and intense, vanilla and boozy. Taste sweet overripe fruit, vanilla and warm distilled spirit.

Tap at the Borefts after party 2016 @ Kaapse. Poured a hazy dark brown with a thin whispy white head. The aroma is rich creamy yeast, sweet malt alcohol red berry fruit. The flavour moderate sweet with a super smooth rich bourbon alcoholic creamy fruit palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation. Superb.

On tap at Kaapse festival shared. 
Thin tan head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Never had moonshine but thus beer is very good
